GM,UPDATE 1-Federal monitor for GM appointed in ignition switch settlement NEW YORK, Oct 29 A former top prosecutor in New York City has been appointed as the federal monitor for General Motors Co following its agreement last month to pay $900 million to end a U.S. criminal probe over a lethal defect in its vehicle ignition switches. ~Federal monitor for GM appointed in ignition switch settlement NEW YORK A former top prosecutor in Manhattan has been appointed as the federal monitor for General Motors Co following its agreement last month to pay $900 million to end a U.S. criminal probe over a lethal defect in its vehicle ignition switches. ~Federal monitor for GM appointed in ignition switch settlement NEW YORK, Oct 29 A former top prosecutor in Manhattan has been appointed as the federal monitor for General Motors Co following its agreement last month to pay $900 million to end a U.S. criminal probe over a lethal defect in its vehicle ignition switches. ~UPDATE 1-As LG Elec profit skids, home appliance lift cushions smartphone losses SEOUL, Oct 29 South Korea's LG Electronics Inc  reported a 37 percent slide in quarterly profit as its mobile device business lost money, but still beat market expectations on strong home appliances earnings and sales of high-end televisions. ~

MRO,UPDATE 1-Marathon Oil slashes dividend, capex to save cash Oct 29 U.S. oil producer Marathon Oil Corp  on Thursday said it is slashing its quarterly dividend 76 percent and further  reducing capital expenditures to preserve cash on hand as it tries to withstand a prolonged crude price slump. ~Marathon Oil slashes dividend to save cash amid oil slump Oct 29 Oil producer Marathon Oil Corp  said it is cutting its quarterly dividend to 5 cents per share from 21 cents, to shore up finances amid a prolonged crude price slump. ~
